channel.title: Programming Classes
channel.description:
So next semester I will start taking java 1 at a community college in my town. Is taking programming classes worth the money and worth the time? I could learn [i]more[/i] of it on my own but with high school plus a job, I have barely any time to devote it to learning a new language. I'd like to hear some thoughts on this.
Also, I am done with high school by December 20th, which leaves me an entire semester to work and study. If you suggest books over classes what books are worth getting?

item.title: Programming Classes
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:3, topic:462931”]Also, how would taking a class give you more free time? You’ll have more free time by learning at your leisure.[/quote]I forgot to mention that I don’t have any classes next semester other than if I choose to voluntarily take more college classes (I’m in a few right now).

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Classes
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

The Web Guy:

Personally, I’d recommend getting books

This.

A class is only as good as It’s teacher. Also: Documents, Libraries, etcetera.

Also, how would taking a class give you more free time? You’ll have more free time by learning at your leisure.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Classes
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Personally, I’d recommend getting books, if you’re going to spend your money on anything. Classes are very slow-paced, and sometimes you don’t get a full understanding. With books or teaching yourself, you get to work at your own pace, whenever you have the time to.

Read full topic
